name: immaturity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour that is not as calm and wise as people expect from someone of your age: emotional immaturity He faced looming middle age with selfish immaturity.
the fact of not having much experience of something: The minister’s bad temper and political immaturity brought one disaster after another. His piano performance showed playing of disturbing immaturity.
the state of being not yet completely grown or developed: physical immaturity The crying of an infant points to neurological immaturity, not bad parenting. See
immature
More examplesFewer examplesHe accused the corporation of arrogance, immaturity, and acting against the public interest.Poor decisions by teenage drivers can be linked to psychological immaturity.They realized the prisoner was a child only when doctors noticed his physical immaturity.
